title: PM Modi mocks INDIA bloc with 'sleepless nights' jab as Tharoor, Vijayan look on
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Vizhinjam International Seaport in Kerala, taking a subtle jab at the opposition INDIA bloc, noting the presence of Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor. Vijayan expressed gratitude to PM Modi for dedicating the project, while Tharoor welcomed the Prime Minister to his constituency.

title: Crossborder tensions could disrupt sub-continent cricket calendar
content: Tensions between India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh threaten to disrupt the subcontinent's cricket calendar. India's scheduled tour of Bangladesh faces uncertainty due to recent controversial statements from a retired Bangladeshi army officer. The 2025 Asia Cup's fate is also in doubt following the Pahalgam terror attack, making India's participation against Pakistan unlikely.

title: Video shows Suhas Shetty's murder in Mangaluru, city on high alert
content: Suhas Shetty, a known rowdy sheeter, was brutally murdered in Mangaluru, with CCTV footage capturing the daylight attack by multiple assailants. Police have registered a murder case and launched a manhunt, suspecting the crime was premeditated. Prohibitory orders have been imposed to prevent further violence, as Shetty was an accused in a previous murder case that triggered communal tension.

title: 'She kept asking me to marry her': Cabbie kills Gurgaon woman
content: A chance encounter in Uttarakhand between taxi driver Mustaq Ahmed and Pooja, a passenger, turned into a tragic love affair, culminating in a gruesome murder. Mustaq, already married, allegedly killed Pooja after she insisted on marriage, even after discovering his secret wedding.

title: Zomato 'quietly ends' food delivery service it started just 4 months back
content: Zomato has quietly removed its 15-minute food delivery service, Quick, from its app after just four months, hinting at a change in its rapid delivery strategy. This follows the shutdown of Zomato Instant in 2023. The company is now focusing on Bistro by Blinkit for quick snack deliveries amid increasing competition, separating it from the main restaurant delivery service.

title: Mumbai court says life term for rapist dad too harsh, gives 20 years
content: A special judge in Mumbai sentenced a 40-year-old man to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for repeatedly raping his 13-year-old daughter. The judge opted against a life sentence, considering the lack of family support for the victim and her sisters, the father's good behavior in jail, and absence of prior criminal record.

title: India’s manufacturing growth hits 10-month high in April on export surge: Report
content: India's manufacturing sector surged in April, reaching a 10-month high driven by strong export orders and output growth. Companies increased selling prices at the fastest rate in over 11 years due to rising costs. Hiring activity also accelerated, reflecting robust demand and positive business confidence for the year ahead.

title: Angry over break-up, man sets ex-girlfriend on fire in Chennai
content: In Navalur, Rathnam set Gayathri on fire. Gayathri ended their relationship. Rathnam wanted to discuss an important matter with her. An argument broke out. Rathnam poured petrol on Gayathri and himself. He set her ablaze. People rushed to help Gayathri. They caught Rathnam. Thazhambur police arrested him. Police registered a case of attempted murder.

title: 'We did not have confidence': Zoho founder as company shelves $700 mn chip plan
content: Zoho has halted its $700 million investment in chip manufacturing due to a lack of confidence in available technology. The company, which intended to invest $400 million in a Karnataka-based semiconductor facility, decided to shelve the plan until a more promising technological approach emerges. This decision follows concerns about securing taxpayer money without certainty in the tech.

title: Global Press Freedom at 'all-time low' in 2025, RSF says
content: Reporters Without Borders (RSF) reports global press freedoms at a record low, particularly criticizing the US under Donald Trump for undermining independent media. The US fell to 57th place in the rankings. Europe enjoys the most press freedom, while China, North Korea, and Eritrea rank lowest. Germany also slipped due to hostility towards journalists.

title: National Herald case: Sonia Gandhi, Rahul get court notice
content: A Delhi court has issued a notice to Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi concerning the National Herald money laundering case, following a previous temporary refusal. The Enforcement Directorate filed a chargesheet on April 9, alleging Rs 5,000 crore in proceeds of crime. The chargesheet names five individuals and two companies, including Young Indian, where the Gandhis hold a controlling interest.

title: China’s pain to India’s gain? India may strike better deal with Trump
content: Amid US-China trade tensions, India and Japan could negotiate more favorable trade deals with the US. However, they are unlikely to jeopardize their significant trade relationships with China, which has warned against agreements detrimental to its interests.

title: Hania Aamir on her 'viral request' to PM Modi: I want to address this…
content: Pakistani actress Hania Aamir has refuted a fabricated social media post falsely attributed to her, which blamed Pakistan's military for the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Aamir clarified on Instagram that the statement is entirely fabricated and misrepresents her beliefs. Her statement comes amidst the suspension of several Pakistani influencers' Instagram accounts in India, including Aamir's, following the recent terror incident.

title: Watch: IAF might on display on Ganga Expressway in UP amid India-Pak tensions
content: The Indian Air Force conducted a major exercise on the Ganga Expressway, testing its use as an emergency runway amid rising tensions with Pakistan after the Pahalgam terror attack. India's military forces have heightened alert levels across land, sea, and air.

title: Ailing bride in his arms, groom takes ‘saat phere’ at hospital OPD in MP
content: In a heartwarming turn of events, a hospital OPD in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh district became a wedding venue. Aditya Singh and Nandini Solanki, determined to marry on Akshay Tritiya, faced a hurdle when Nandini fell ill and was hospitalized.

title: Kajal in Gujarat, Seema in Haryana, Neha in Bihar: Who is ‘Daku Dulhan’?
content: Gulshana Riaz Khan, known as 'Daku Dulhan', faced arrest with her gang. They ran a marriage racket across states. Gulshana posed as a bride, conning families. After weddings, she vanished with valuables. Police caught them in Ambedkar Nagar. The gang targeted vulnerable families. They staged abductions after lavish ceremonies. Haryana groom's alarm led to the arrests.

title: Schoolgirl held captive, gangraped for 3 days in MP's Mandla
content: In Mandla, a class 7 girl from Jabalpur was repeatedly gangraped for three days after being lured by a social media acquaintance, Rajan, with the promise of visiting Kanha Tiger Reserve. Police report that she was held captive at a friend's house. The accused threatened her before abandoning her at the bus stand.

title: 'We have a past': Now, Pakistan's Bhutto admits to country’s role in backing terror
content: Former Pakistani Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari acknowledged Pakistan's past involvement in funding extremist groups, aligning with recent admissions from the defense minister. He highlighted the country's role in supporting the Mujahideen during the Afghan war, in collaboration with Western powers. Bhutto asserted that Pakistan has since reformed its policies and taken action against extremism, particularly after experiencing significant terrorist attacks.

title: ’Seismic shift in US trade policy…’: S&P cuts India’s GDP growth forecast again
content: S&P Global Ratings has lowered India's GDP growth forecasts for 2025-26 and 2026-27, citing trade-related uncertainties stemming from potential US tariff policies. This revision aligns with similar downward adjustments by the Reserve Bank of India.

title: ‘Raid 2’ box office: Ajay Devgn film holds strong as year’s number 2 opening
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2', also featuring Riteish Deshmukh and Vaani Kapoor, had a strong opening, earning ₹19.25 crore on its first day, becoming the second-highest opener of the year after 'Chhaava'. Early trends for day 2 show ₹1.29 crore in morning collections, with expectations of growth over the weekend.

title: Trump's tariffs hit China! Unrest & mass protests erupt
content: Civil unrest is erupting across China due to the severe impact of US tariffs imposed by President Trump. Factory closures and unpaid wages have triggered large-scale worker demonstrations from Shanghai to Inner Mongolia.

title: Gujarat man hanged in Kuwait for murdering his employer in 2019
content: Mustakim Bhathiara, a 38-year-old Indian cook from Kapadvanj, was executed in Kuwait on April 28 for the 2019 murder of his employer, Rehana Khan. He had been working in Kuwait for seven years after previous stints in Dubai and Bahrain. Following his conviction in 2021, his body was returned to Ahmedabad and buried in Kapadvanj on Wednesday.

title: Jaishankar or Sudha Murthy's kids? Cong on Himanta’s 'children not citizens' claim
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma's claim that an Assam MP's minor children are no longer Indian citizens has drawn sharp criticism from Congress. The party questioned Sarma's allegations, demanding specificity and accusing him of targeting political opponents. Furthermore, Congress has filed police complaints against Sarma for alleged derogatory remarks against women during a recent election campaign.

title: Kerala Cricket Association suspends Sreesanth for three years. Why?
content: The Kerala Cricket Association (KCA) has suspended former Indian pacer S. Sreesanth for three years following derogatory statements against the association regarding Sanju Samson's exclusion from the Champions Trophy squad. The decision was made during a special General Body meeting. While franchise teams received warnings, the KCA will pursue compensation claims against Samson's father and others for making baseless allegations.

title: Karnataka SSLC result 2025 announced: Check direct link to access scorecards
content: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board (KSEAB) has announced the SSLC examination results for 2025. Students can access their results on karresults.nic.in and kseab.karnataka.gov.in using their registration number. Alternative methods to check results include SMS, DigiLocker, and verified mobile applications, providing multiple avenues for students to view their scores.

title: SC halts family's deportation to Pak, asks authorities to not take 'coercive action'
content: The Supreme Court has halted the deportation of a Bengaluru man and his family to Pakistan, instructing the government to verify their citizenship claims. The family asserts their Indian nationality, possessing Indian passports and Aadhaar cards.

title: Pak stock market crashes over 7,000 points since Pahalgam attack
content: Following a terrorist attack in Pahalgam and escalating tensions with India, Pakistan's stock market experienced a significant crash, with the KSE-100 index plummeting over 7,100 points.

title: IPL 2025: CSK, RR out of playoff race, what about the others?
content: Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bengaluru are leading the IPL 2025 playoff race, needing just one win each to secure their spots. Punjab Kings, Gujarat Titans, and Delhi Capitals are also in a strong position, requiring two wins from their remaining matches.

title: Shops damaged, many attacked: Communal violence in Nainital after man, 75, rapes minor
content: Communal violence erupted in Nainital following the arrest of Mohammed Usman for allegedly raping a minor, leading to vandalism and business closures. Right-wing groups protested, targeting Muslim-owned shops, while authorities deployed additional police forces. The Uttarakhand High Court intervened, ordering heightened security and social media monitoring to prevent further unrest, as community leaders called for calm and justice.

title: Adam Gilchrist compares Jasprit Bumrah to legendary Australian
content: Jasprit Bumrah's stellar IPL 2025 performance, marked by exceptional economy and dot ball percentage, has propelled MI to the top of the points table. Despite missing initial matches, his impact is undeniable. Adam Gilchrist likened Bumrah to Don Bradman, citing his dominance across formats. Gilchrist also highlighted Bumrah's impact during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where his bowling intimidated the Australians.

title: Gold rate today: Yellow metal down Rs 6,700 per 10 grams from peak
content: Gold rate today: Gold futures saw a slight increase today, while silver also edged higher, following previous day's declines in both domestic and international markets. Prices had corrected sharply due to optimism surrounding potential US trade agreements and a stronger dollar.

title: JD Vance says US hopes Pakistan cooperates with India against terrorists
content: "Our hope here is that India responds to this terrorist attack in a way that doesn't lead to a broader regional conflict," Vance said in a podcast interview with Fox News. "And we hope, frankly, that Pakistan, to the extent that they're responsible, cooperates with India to make sure that the terrorists sometimes operating in their territory are hunted down and dealt with," Vance added.

title: Apple expects $900m hit from US tariffs, shifts majority of iPhone production to India
content: Apple reported strong first-quarter profits, but CEO Tim Cook cautioned about US tariffs potentially costing the company $900 million this quarter. To mitigate this, Apple is shifting production, with most iPhones sold in the US originating from India. "We are not able to precisely estimate the impact of tariffs, as we are uncertain of potential future actions prior to the end of the quarter," news agency Reuters quoted Tim Cook as saying.

title: 'Assaulted with weapons': How was murder accused Suhas Shetty killed in Mangaluru
content: Tensions are high in Mangaluru following the murder of Hindutva activist Suhas Shetty, prompting police to impose prohibitory orders until May 6. Shetty, a known rowdy sheeter, was attacked by unidentified assailants, leading to his death. The police have launched a manhunt and are investigating the motive, while also working to maintain public order amidst potential unrest.

title: ‘Daku Dulhan’ who duped 12 grooms arrested in UP
content: Police in Ambedkar Nagar arrested Gulshana Riaz Khan, infamously known as 'Daku Dulhan,' and eight gang members for allegedly defrauding at least twelve families. Gulshana, posing under various aliases, would marry grooms and then vanish with valuables. The gang targeted families struggling to find matches, extracting money before the staged abduction.

title: IPL match today: GT vs SRH - all you need to know
content: Gujarat Titans are set to clash with Sunrisers Hyderabad, aiming to rebound after Vaibhav Suryavanshi's stunning century. GT, with six wins, eye a playoff berth, relying on their strong batting lineup led by Sai Sudharsan and Shubman Gill. SRH, struggling with three wins, desperately need a victory to keep their playoff hopes alive.

title: 2nd in 2+ months: Student from Nepal dies by suicide at Odisha’s KIIT
content: Another Nepalese student was discovered dead in her hostel room at KIIT, Bhubaneswar. This incident occurred nearly two and a half months after a similar death. Police suspect suicide and have ruled out foul play. The 18-year-old was a first-year BTech student. Her phone and laptop are under forensic examination. The motive remains unclear as investigations continue.

title: IPL qualification scenarios: Can Rajasthan make the playoffs?
content: Rajasthan Royals suffered a crushing 100-run defeat to Mumbai Indians at their home in Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur on Thursday night. MI's dominant performance, fuelled by strong batting from Rickelton, Sharma, Yadav and Pandya, and a stellar bowling display, propelled them to the top of the table.

title: Tariff talks back on table? China says 'evaluating' US offer, 'door open'
content: China says it is open to restarting trade talks with the United States, but made it clear that dialogue can only move forward if Washington cancels its steep unilateral tariffs. In a statement from the commerce ministry, Beijing  insisted that words alone were not enough. China also noted multiple informal outreach attempts from the US, but said any genuine negotiations must be backed by action, not pressure or double-speak.

title: Brunson's clutch 3 sinks Pistons; Knicks advance
content: Jalen Brunson made a 3-pointer with 5.1 seconds remaining and the Knicks defeated the Pistons 116-113 to advance to the Eastern semifinals.

title: Clips spurred by Lue's calls, stay alive vs. Nuggets
content: James Harden rebounded from a quiet Game 5 on Tuesday to score 28 points, Kawhi Leonard added 27 points and the Clippers forced a Game 7 of their first-round playoff series with a 111-105 win over the Nuggets in Game 6 on Thursday.

title: Redick: Lakers must get in 'championship shape'
content: Head coach JJ Redick says the Lakers must get into "championship shape" if they're going to contend for an NBA title next season.

title: MacKinnon's 'super lucky' late goal keeps Avs alive
content: Nathan MacKinnon got credit for a go-ahead goal with 10:56 remaining after the puck bounced off the shoulder of a Dallas player, and the Colorado Avalanche staved off elimination by beating the Stars 7-4 in Game 6 on Thursday night.

title: Haliburton's dad to stay away from Pacers games
content: After conversations with the Pacers' front office, Tyrese Haliburton's father, John, will not attend the team's home and road games for the foreseeable future, a Pacers spokesperson told ESPN.

title: Sources: Rangers close to hiring Sullivan as coach
content: The New York Rangers are in advanced contract talks to make former Pittsburgh Penguins coach Mike Sullivan the next head coach, sources told ESPN's Emily Kaplan and Kevin Weekes on Thursday.

title: Angels to put Trout on IL with bone bruise in knee
content: The Angels will put outfielder Mike Trout on the injured list because of a bone bruise in his left knee, manager Ron Washington said Thursday night.

title: Fan who fell at PNC Park still in critical condition
content: The man who fell from the 21-foot-high Clemente Wall onto the field at PNC Park on Wednesday remained in critical condition. Police called the incident "accidental."

title: 📈 MLB Power Rankings: Who sits atop our list?
content: The NL is still dominating MLB -- and our rankings -- while an AL East team continues to tumble down the Week 5 list.

title: What a championship for these 10 playoff teams would say about the NBA
content: From the Celtics to the Thunder, here's how potential titles could lead into varied versions of an NBA future.

title: NBA offseason preview: Complete guides for Pistons, Lakers and every eliminated team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Which NFL teams already need a QB for 2026? Reid’s first-round mock draft has four in the top 10
content: Four QBs in the top 10? Two big trades? Let's make way-too-early predictions for every pick of next year's first round.

title: Europa League continues to offer Man United a lifeline for this season
content: This Manchester United team that has struggled in the Premier League continues to look far better in the Europa League.

title: How every five-star recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: College Football Playoff impact: Players who stuck around
content: The portal closed and the draft ended. Who are the best players who stuck around even though they had options?

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Times Square fights: Rank-and-file boxers are being failed
content: On a weekend where Ryan Garcia and Canelo Alvarez are stealing the spotlight, the sport is failing its true boxers.

title: Betting the 151st Kentucky Derby: What you need to know to make a smart race wager
content: The basics and insider intel you need to sound smart while betting the most exciting two minutes in sports.

title: In its spell as F1 host, Miami has become America's Monaco
content: A good F1 venue goes beyond on-track action, and when it comes to spectacle and fun, Miami is second to none.

title: Wins put Man Utd, Spurs on brink of unlikely final
content: Big wins for Man United and Tottenham in the Europa League semifinals kept alive their hopes of lifting a major trophy and qualifying for the Champions League.

title: Sources: Brazil give Ancelotti May 26 deadline
content: The Brazilian Football Confederation (CBF) on Thursday extended its deadline for Carlo Ancelotti to take over as national team coach, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: De Bruyne in talks for MLS move to Fire
content: Chicago Fire FC is in talks with Manchester City star Kevin De Bruyne on a designated player contract, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Maguire revels in 'Harrydinho' nickname: 'Brilliant'
content: Harry Maguire has welcomed his new Brazilian-inspired nickname after the centre-back's unexpected trickery helped put Manchester United on course for a stunning 3-0 win at Athletic Club.

title: Amorim: Man Utd can't take final place for granted
content: Ruben Amorim warned his Manchester United players that they have not yet booked their place in the Europa League final despite a dominant 3-0 win over Athletic Club in their semifinal first leg.

title: Chelsea with one foot in final after 1st-leg rout
content: Goals from Jadon Sancho and Noni Madueke and a brace from Nicolas Jackson gave Chelsea a comfortable 4-1 win over Swedish side Djurgården on a tricky artificial pitch in the first leg of their Conference League semifinal on Thursday.

title: Spain national team superfan Manolo dies at 76
content: Globally recognized Spanish superfan Manuel Caceres, known for his drum-pounding support of Spain's national team across ten World Cups and eight Euros, died on Thursday at the age of 76.

title: Sources: Barça's Kounde to miss Inter 2nd leg
content: Barcelona have confirmed defender Jules Kounde suffered a hamstring injury in Wednesday's 3-3 Champions League semifinal draw against Inter Milan, with sources telling ESPN he will miss the second leg in Italy next week.

title: Advantage PSG vs. Arsenal, Barca-Inter thriller: UCL semifinals, assessed
content: The Champions League, Europa League and Europa Conference League are thrilling as we hit the semifinals. Can Arsenal fight back vs. PSG? Let's break down all the first legs and project what's to come.

title: Real Madrid's running battle with referees: How did it start? When will it end?
content: Madrid's anger escalated in the Copa del Rey final, with an official in tears and three players sent off.

title: Draft tiers at forward/center
content: Andre Snellings goes through the different tiers at the forward/center position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: If parity is NWSL's 'superpower' vs. Europe competition, is expansion its kryptonite?
content: The NWSL has excitement that the UEFA Women's Champions League and England's WSL can't match -- but how long will it last?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid to rival Man United for Mastantuono
content: Real Madrid, Man United and half of Europe want to sign River Plate wonderkid Franco Mastantuono. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Karnataka High Court dismisses petition by BJP MLC C. T. Ravi against FIR filed by Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar for alleged derogatory remarks
content: The criminal proceeding was initiated based on an FIR for an offence punishable under Sections 75 and 79 of the BNS, both of which deal with intent to assault or outrage the modesty of a woman

title: Utsav Patel of Hassan scores 625/625 in SSLC exams in Karnataka
content: He told The Hindu that said he had the support and encouragement of teachers, parents and his elder sister, who is pursuing a course in engineering in Bengaluru

title: Deeply saddened: MEA on death of Nepalese student at Odisha's KIIT
content: The ministry expressed condolences over the tragic death of a Nepalese student at KIIT University; promises full support and investigation

title: Two Mysuru students among toppers in SSLC exams in Karnataka
content: The management of their respective schools expressed joy over the results, saying they had anticipated strong performances from their students

title: Tamil Nadu anganwadi workers stage sit-in protest; Minister warns of disciplinary action
content: The Anganwadi Workers and Assistants Association staged the protest, demanding a vacation for the whole month of May, without any warning, the Minister said

title: Government Urdu school student from Sirsi is among toppers in Karnataka SSLC exams Shagufta
content: She attributed her success to the coaching and encouragement from her teachers and parents, and hard work

title: BJP govt's pattern to oppose good policy, defame, then adopt it under pressure: Congress
content: “This government is only adept at diverting the attention of the public, running away from the real issues and furthering its divisive agenda,” said Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Political undercurrents mark Vizhinjam port inauguration by PM Modi
content: Modi takes oblique dig at Congress national leadership by observing that two prominent INDIA bloc leaders – Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and Shashi Tharoor – shared the high-profile stage with him

title: Former minister K.S. Eshwarappa welcomes Centre’s decision on caste census, questions Karnataka CM on delay in releasing data collected 10 years ago
content: K.S. Eshwarappa wanted to know why Rahul Gandhi cannot ask Siddaramaiah to release the data of caste census collected in Karnataka 10 years ago

title: T.N. CM Stalin distributes awards to three farmers for excellence in organic farming
content: G. Sampathkumar from Coimbatore district secured the first prize, while T. Jagadeesh from Tiruppur district and V. Kalidoss from Nagapattinam district received the second and third prizes, respectively

title: Assam Panchayat polls: Over 24% voter turnout till 11.30 am amid stray incidents of violence
content: Incidents of violence have been reported from some places, with voting getting briefly disrupted at a few polling stations, an official said

title: Minister Shivanand Patil resigns from Assembly, challenges Basanagouda Patil Yatnal to quit MLA seat in Karnataka
content: Minister Shivanand Patil asks Speaker U. T. Khader to accept his resignation only if Basanagouda Patil Yatnal resigns from his MLA seat

title: More than 4,000 buses, 3,000 cars reach Amaravati for PM Modi’s public meeting
content: Almost all the eight roads leading to the Amaravati capital have been overloaded with the buses, cars and other vehicles in which the attendees have been coming to participate in the mega public meeting.

title: Opposition in Maharashtra demands to make film ‘Phule’ tax-free and screen in schools
content: The film has already attracted criticism from the Brahmin community for allegedly showing the community in a bad light

title: Vizhinjam port: Kerala CM hails landmark maritime gateway to global trade
content: Vizhinjam International Seaport is result of ‘collective will and determination’ shown by LDF in Kerala, says Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Tata AIG upbeat on AP, Telangana for health insurance business growth
content: 8% of Rs. 47,000 crore all India retail health insurance business originates in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana: Rudraraju Rajagopal, head - Accident and Health Claims

title: KCA suspends Sreesanth for three years over remarks in Sanju Samson row
content: Kerala Cricket Association suspends Sreesanth for three years over derogatory remarks, advises caution in team management appointments

title: Supreme Court protects family facing deportation to Pakistan, asks authorities to verify documents
content: The top court halts deportation of Kashmiri family to Pakistan pending identity document verification, citing human angle

title: Murder of Hindu activist in Mangaluru: Two arrested for attempt on life of autorickshaw driver near Udupi
content: In a video statement, Superintendent of Police K. Arun said the arrested persons told the police that the attempt on the life of the autorickshaw driver was to seek revenge for the murder of Suhas Shetty

title: Elderly couple robbed, murdered in Erode; Palaniswami condemns DMK government
content: Inspector General of Police (IGP), West Zone, T. Senthil Kumar, who visited the crime scene, said that eight special teams have been formed to apprehend the perpetrators

title: All-party meeting in Punjab over water-sharing issue called by AAP begins
content: Mann on Thursday asserted that the AAP government will not allow the release of more water to the neighbouring State, claiming it has already utilised its share

title: Karnataka class 10 SSLC exam results announced, 22 students score 625/625 marks
content: Dakshina Kannada district topped the State with 91.12% pass percentage in regular fresh students followed by Udupi with 89.96%, Uttara Kannada with 83.19%, and Shivamogga with 82.29%

title: WAVES summit 2025 | Global Media Dialogue to pave way for tech-driven pluralism and democratisation of international system, says Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister emphasises the importance of pluralism, creativity, and ethics in “democratising” the world order

title: In pictures: At Amritsar’s Attari border, Indians and Pakistanis bid tearful farewells
content: A total of 911 Pakistani nationals left India through the Attari-Wagah border in the last seven days.

title: PM Modi dedicates Vizhinjam international seaport to the nation
content: Positioned hardly 10 nautical miles from international shipping routes, Vizhinjam port is expected to significantly reduce India’s dependence on other international ports for transshipment of cargo

title: Pahalgam attack | Pakistan addresses ‘humanitarian challenges’ caused by India’s visa cancellation
content: Pakistan’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs said that many “fragile health” patients returned to Pakistan without completing their treatment, causing “humanitarian challenges”

title: Political battle over Vizhinjam port credit flares ahead of PM Modi’s inauguration
content: Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan, who opted out of the inauguration ceremony, shares video of former Kerala CM Oommen Chandy’s speech made in Kerala Assembly on Vizhinjam port in 2015

title: Delhi HC refuses to recall order directing TMC MP Saket Gokhale to pay ₹50 lakh damages to ex-diplomat
content: Lakshmi Murdeshwar Puri had approached the high court in 2021, alleging Mr. Gokhale tarnished her goodwill and reputation by making reckless and false allegations about her financial affairs

title: From millets to mistrust, a harvest gone sour
content: For over 40 years, the Deccan Development Society helped transform lives in Telangana’s Zaheerabad mandal, turning fallow lands fertile and empowering Dalit women through sanghams, savings and seeds. But today, the same women who built the movement are demanding answers: What happened to their years of deposits? Who sold their land? How did a movement rooted in collective trust begin to feel so distant, so opaque? As faith frays and misgivings grow, Serish Nanisetti traces the unraveling of a once-iconic grassroots model

title: Pakistani troops violate ceasefire for 8th night, residents near LoC begin readying bunkers
content: This is the eighth consecutive night of unprovoked firing along the LoC, amid heightened tensions following the April 22 terror attack in Pahalgam in which 26 people were killed

title: Hesaraghatta grasslands will remain untouched
content: The grassland region in Hesaraghatta forms a unique ecosystem close to Bengaluru and supports numerous species of flora and fauna, many endangered

title: Botcha demands judicial probe into wall collapse at Simhachalam temple
content: The YSRCP leader describes the seven deaths as ‘murders by the government’, says the ‘High-level Committee’ formed for the proper conduct of the Chandanotsavam should own up responsibility

title: Critical care castaways of tri-State border
content: Many lives remain at risk in the Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh, where the government district hospital refers over 75% of critical care and emergency cases to hospitals located more than 100 kilometres away. Despite being the vital junction where Andhra Pradesh meets Tamil Nadu and Karnataka, critical healthcare continues to elude the predominantly rural district, finds K. Umashanker

title: PM Modi in Thiruvananthapuram, set to commission Vizhinjam international seaport
content: Thiruvananthapuram has come under heightened security and traffic control on account of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s arrival

title: Blackspots resurface showing all is not well in solid waste management in Mangaluru
content: Blackspots have gone up in the past one year, but the civic Commissioner maintained that the corporation has not been receiving complaints from people regarding garbage not being lifted

title: VHP calls for bandh in Dakshina Kannada, police impose prohibitory orders in Mangaluru
content: People came in large numbers and visited the mortuary of the private hospital in Mangaluru where the body of Bajrang Dal activist Suhas Shetty was kept on May 1.

title: Passenger, airport ground staffers held with smuggled gold worth ₹3.45 crore at RGIA
content: Acting on specific intelligence inputs, officers from the Hyderabad zonal unit of the DRI intercepted the accused

title: Air India sees Pakistan airspace ban costing it $600 million over 12 months, seeks aid
content: Air India, which has a 26.5% market share in India, flies to Europe, the United States and Canada, often crossing Pakistan's airspace. It operates many more long-haul routes than bigger domestic rival IndiGo

title: Experts say listing of castes will be first challenge in Census
content: In the absence of a concrete listing of castes and communities to be enumerated, the 2011 Census showed over 46 lakh different ‘castes’, with many citizens entering their surnames under the field for caste

title: Centre defers May 4 meeting with farmers over participation of Punjab Government
content: Union Agriculture Ministry claims the farming community harboured deep resentment against the Punjab government over the eviction of protesting farmers from Shambhu and Khanauri border points in March

title: Heavy rain, strong winds batter Delhi; woman, 3 children die in house collapse
content: Three flights were diverted and over 100 flights were delayed at the Delhi airport as thunderstorms and gusty winds disrupted operations

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: Pakistan to allow stranded citizens to return via Wagah border after visa revocations
content: The Supreme Court has asked authorities not to deport six members of a Pakistan family, who allegedly overstayed their visa, till an order on verification of their identity documents.

title: HC pulls up M.P. Police, over ‘inaction’ on Ambedkar statue vandalism
content: The petition was filed by Jitendra Ahirwar, a local social activist, who alleged ‘inaction’ on the local police’s part and sought the court’s intervention

title: A.P. CM assures support to a widow in Nellorepalem
content: Chandrababu Naidu directed Nellore District Collector O. Anand to offer DSC coaching to Susmita, and to provide a drone to her younger brother, who has completed ITI, for agricultural purposes

title: Opposition slams Maharashtra government over claims of good performance
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and member of the Maharashtra Legislative Council, Ambadas Danve’s statement was in the response to the CM’s 100-day performance report that he released on Maharashtra Day, May 1, 2025.

title: Above-normal maximum, minimum temperatures in Andhra Pradesh in May: IMD
content: The probability of above-normal minimum temperatures in the State is between 33.5% and 65%; however, the number of heatwave days, on an average, is likely to be fewer in May

title: Jostling intensifies among parties in Bihar to claim credit over caste Census
content: Ruling JD(U) claims it was because of CM Nitish Kumar, whereas Congress gave credit to Rahul Gandhi; RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav says it was important to see when the caste Census gets conducted as it is delayed by four years

title: Lingayats and Vokkaligas want implementation of ‘caste census’ put on hold till enumeration by Union govt.
content: Union government’s caste census announcement complicates Karnataka’s survey implementation, sparking debate among influential communities and political figures.

title: Case filed over alleged pro-Pakistan sloganeering at Indore protest against Pahalgam attack
content: An anti-Pakistan protest had been organised on April 25 at Badwali in Sadar Bazaar by the local Muslim community

title: Communal tension in Nainital after minor assaulted by senior citizen
content: As the news of the incident spread, people gathered near the market where the accused used to work, and vandalised shops run by the minority community; police have placed restrictions dampening tourist footfall during peak summer season

title: NDA government bringing light in the lives of workers: A.P. CM
content: New 100-bed hospitals are being built in Guntur and Sri City each, and a 30-bed hospital in Kurnool for the healthcare of workers, says Naidu

title: Chennai to soon get mobile app to report snake, wildlife sightings
content: The initiative by the Tamil Nadu Forest Department aims to streamline the process to request rescue assistance

title: Indians and Pakistanis at Attari border: The people who bear the weight of a divided history
content: Amid a relatively quiet Beating Retreat ceremony that takes place every evening at the Attari-Wagah border are Indians and Pakistanis, who share similar emotions. Some cry and others pray for resilience as nationals from both countries cross borders, leaving family members grieving and in disquiet. Vikas Vasudeva reports from the border villages and Amritsar, just 50 km down the road from Lahore, once its twin city

title: Veteran Congress leader Girija Vyas passes away
content: The former Union Minister had sustained burn injuries during a Gangaur puja ritual at her residence in Udaipur

title: Mallika Sarabhai defies pressure, joins ASHA workers’ protest virtually
content: Ms. Sarabhai participated in the event, ‘Honorarium for ASHA workers’, a citizen’s crowd funding campaign, by transferring honorarium of ₹1,000 to one of the protesting workers

title: Vizhinjam seaport set to boost South Asia’s maritime trade
content: PM Narendra Modi to dedicate the project to the nation; the seaport will have an AI-driven control room; the new port is expected to reduce India’s dependence on international facilities

title: See AI as a creative enabler, not a job displacer, say industry leaders at WAVES 2025
content: Sessions highlight India’s growing role in content creation and AI-driven storytelling, with emphasis on creativity, skill, and innovation

title: At Congress Working Committee meet, Congress seeks amendment to lift 50% cap on reservation
content: The Congress says caste census is diversionary tactics; CWC is also likely to reiterate its demand for strong action in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Army, Air Force see major changes at the top as new leaders take over
content: Lt. Gen. Pratik Sharma is the new Northern Army Commander; changes at the top will initiate a series of changes in the top hierarchy in the Army and IAF

title: HAL clears Army and Air Force versions of Dhruv helicopter
content: The armed forces had temporarily grounded all their ALHs following a crash during a training sortie in January but the Pahalgam terror attack led to the security personnel requiring the services of the helicopter

title: Sonu Nigam sparks row over Kannada song request, invokes Pahalgam attack
content: Singer Sonu Nigam has invited backlash for getting upset with a boy who requested for a Kannada song during his concert in a college in Bengaluru

title: Centre brings raw sugar into regulatory ambit
content: Union government expands Sugar (Control) Order to include raw sugar and khandsari units, aims for better regulation and transparency

title: 'He's a devout Catholic': Vance on making Rubio next Pope

title: Opposition attacks Maharashtra CM’s report, cites rural distress and farmer suicides
content: In the 100-day performance report, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that 12 of the 48 departments have performed well and achieved 100% of their targets

title: 1,000-foot UFO image sparks debate: Alien truth or optical illusion?
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: NCAA deal with sportsbooks looks crass but is sneaky smart
content: college athletes face problems because of prop bets . they work with law enforcement, sports wagering integrity watchdogs and casinos themselves . the NCAA's managing director of enforcement spearheads the association's anti-gambling education efforts . "it's absolutely a challenge," says the official of enforcement .

title: Wagah Border To Stay Open For Returning Pakistanis After India Revokes Visa
content: Pakistan has announced to keep the Wagah Border crossing open for its citizens returning from India after New Delhi revoked their visas following the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that claimed 26 lives.

title: Sonia, Rahul Gandhi Get Delhi Court Notice In National Herald Case
content: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi were issued notices by a Delhi court in the National Herald money laundering case.

title: US Health Agency Urges Therapy, Not Transition Treatment For Transgenders
content: Major medical groups and those who treat transgender young people sharply criticised the new report as inaccurate.

title: Climate Change Threatens Indonesia's Historic Clove Farms
content: In a good season, the best of Jauhar's 150 towering trunks can spurt 30 kilogrammes of the aromatic spice used for medicine, perfumes, cigarettes and food flavourings.

title: "Daunting, Frightening": King Charles Opens Up About Fighting Cancer
content: King Charles said he observed during his illness that even in the hardest times, kindness and love from others can bring hope and comfort.

title: "It's Much Better Equipped": Karan Adani On Kerala's Vizhinjam Port
content: The Vizhinjam International Seaport in Kerala - India's first mega transshipment container terminal - was formally inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday

title: Explained: Ukraine's Metals Production, Resources And Development Projects
content: In 2024, Ukraine exported goods worth $41.6 billion, of which metals/metals products accounted for $4.4 billion or 11% of the total, according to the customs service.

title: PM Narendra Modi Remembers Pope Francis During Vizhinjam Seaport Inauguration
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday, while addressing a gathering in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram, paid tribute to Pope Francis, who passed away at the age of 88 on Easter Monday in Vatican City.

title: Bilawal Bhutto Admits Pakistan's "Past" With Terror Groups
content: Bilawal Bhutto acknowledged Pakistan's history with extremism, claiming the nation has suffered as a result and has since reformed.

title: 12th Century Shrine, An Ancient Label: Row Erupts Over 'Jagannath Dham' Tag
content: The inauguration of a new Jagannath temple in Digha has become the centre of a controversy between eastern neighbours Odisha and West Bengal.

title: Canada Election 2025: 22 Candidates Of Punjabi Descent Elected As Canadian MPs
content: In Brampton, a city known for its strong Punjabi presence, the election results were particularly noteworthy. Five constituencies in Brampton featured candidates with Punjabi names, with both the Liberal and Conservative parties claiming wins.

title: Blue Collar Boys, Trump Card: 5 Key Points In Australia Elections
content: Australia has enforced compulsory voting since 1924, with turnout never dipping below 90 percent since then.

title: Marco Rubio Takes Rare Dual Role As Top US Diplomat, Security Chief
content: Marco Rubio has been cheered on by much of Trump's base, some of whom after his nomination derided him as an establishment "warmongering" hawk.

title: US Trade Blacklist On China Riddled With Errors, Outdated Details
content: Doris Au discovered after searching online that another firm with a similar name was added to the US trade blacklist in October 2023.

title: "Shashi Tharoor Is Here": PM's "Sleepless Nights" Jibe At Congress
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's remark during the inauguration of the Vizhinjam International Seaport in Kerala today has once again put the spotlight on Congress MP Shashi Tharoor.

title: Bill Gates Has Asperger Syndrome, His Daughter Phoebe Reveals
content: Bill Gates, earlier, had said that if he were a young boy growing up in today's world, he would "probably be diagnosed on the autism spectrum".

title: Nepalese Girl, 18, Found Dead At Odisha's KIIT, 2nd Case In 90 Days
content: A Nepalese undergraduate student was found dead in her hostel room at the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) in Bhubaneswar on Thursday evening, marking the second such death involving a Nepalese student at the university in 90 days.

title: Who are your club's future stars? Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams
content: the top 10 prospects for all 30 teams are updated below for where they stand entering May . mrs braxton bragg, rHP Levi Wells and c/1B/OF Ethan Anderson were all close to ms bragg . all 30 of these lists are updated regularly throughout the 2025 season .

title: Browns QB Shedeur Sanders makes surprise visit to Cleveland-area high school
content: shedeur Sanders was selected by the Browns in the fifth round . the 6-foot-2 quarterback was taken with the no. 144 pick by the browns . he surprised students at John Marshall High school with words of affirmation .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Brunson dagger sends Knicks to next round
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 3 New York Knicks defeated the No. 6 Detroit Pistons in Game 6 to advance to the second round by winning on a 3-point dagger from Jalen Brunson .

title: PM Modi's "Anger Of Gujarat" Joke In Praise For Gautam Adani In Kerala
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday offered unreserved praise for industrialist Gautam Adani during his speech following the inauguration of the Adani Group-led Vizhinjam International Seaport in Kerala.

title: Air India Allowed To Extend Crew Duty, Rest Periods Amid Pak Airspace Ban
content: The exemption increases the maximum flight duty period - typically the time between reporting for duty and the end of flight-related activities - for pilots and cabin crew, the memo showed.

title: Apple To Source Majority Of US iPhones From India In June Quarter: Tim Cook
content: Apple will source the majority of the iPhone sold in the US from India in the June quarter while China will produce the vast majority of the devices for other markets amid uncertainty over tax tariffs, top official said.

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: the WNBA is a hard league to break into, but rookies are making an impact earlier than ever . in 2023, I recommended not drafting any rookies that weren't the overall no. 1 pick, Aliyah Boston . the 2024 draft class was an outlier from previous history; all four lottery picks averaged over 20 fantasy points per game .

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Sandhagen gets past Figueiredo at UFC Fight Night
content: cory Sandhagen takes on former men's flyweight champion deiveson Figueiredo in main event at UFC Fight Night in Des Moines, Iowa . the bantamweight contender is aiming to bounce back from his first loss since 2023 . he was riding a three-fight win streak before dropping that fight .

title: Bradley's take: Breaking down Garcia vs. Romero, Teofimo-Barboza and more
content: the popular tourist destination will be the stage to a boxing show featuring some of the best fighters in the sport . the ever-popular Ryan Garcia matches up against former junior welterweight champion Rolando "Rolly" Romero . Devin Haney returns against former 140-pound champion Jose Ramirez .

title: West playoffs: Clippers force Game 7
content: the 2024-25 playoffs are in full swing, and our NBA insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the winner of the series will take on the Timberwolves on saturday . this week, the no. 2 Houston Rockets beat the No. 7 Golden State Warriors .
